  async function getWorldBooks_ACU() {
      if (TavernHelper_API_ACU && typeof TavernHelper_API_ACU.getLorebooks === 'function' && typeof TavernHelper_API_ACU.getLorebookEntries === 'function') {
          const bookNames = TavernHelper_API_ACU.getLorebooks();
          const books = [];
          for (const name of bookNames) {
              let entries = await TavernHelper_API_ACU.getLorebookEntries(name);
              // [ä¿®å¤] å°†ä¸–ç•Œä¹¦åç§°æ³¨å…¥åˆ°æ¯ä¸ªæ¡ç›®ä¸­ï¼Œä»¥ä¾¿åç»­å¤„ç†ï¼ˆå¦‚æ£€æŸ¥å¯ç”¨çŠ¶æ€ï¼‰æ—¶å¯ä»¥å¼•ç”¨ã€‚
              if (entries && Array.isArray(entries)) {
                  entries = entries.map(entry => ({ ...entry, book: name }));
              }
              books.push({ name, entries });
          }
          return books;
      }
      // Fallback to original implementation
      if (SillyTavern_API_ACU && typeof SillyTavern_API_ACU.getWorldBooks === 'function') {
          return await SillyTavern_API_ACU.getWorldBooks();
      }
      return [];
  }

  async function getCombinedWorldbookContent_ACU() {
    logDebug_ACU('Starting to get combined worldbook content with advanced logic...');
    const worldbookConfig = settings_ACU.worldbookConfig;

    if (!TavernHelper_API_ACU || !SillyTavern_API_ACU) {
        logWarn_ACU('[ACU] TavernHelper or SillyTavern API not available, cannot get worldbook content.');
        return '';
    }

    try {
        let bookNames = [];
        
        if (worldbookConfig.source === 'manual') {
            bookNames = worldbookConfig.manualSelection || [];
        } else { // 'character' mode
            const charLorebooks = await TavernHelper_API_ACU.getCharLorebooks({ type: 'all' });
            if (charLorebooks.primary) bookNames.push(charLorebooks.primary);
            if (charLorebooks.additional?.length) bookNames.push(...charLorebooks.additional);
        }

        if (bookNames.length === 0) {
            logDebug_ACU('No worldbooks selected or available for the character.');
            return '';
        }

        let allEntries = [];
        for (const bookName of bookNames) {
            if (bookName) {
                const entries = await TavernHelper_API_ACU.getLorebookEntries(bookName);
                if (entries?.length) {
                    // Inject bookName into each entry for later reference
                    entries.forEach(entry => allEntries.push({ ...entry, bookName }));
                }
            }
        }

        // [æ–°å¢] é»˜è®¤ä¸è¯»å–ç”±æ’ä»¶ç”Ÿæˆçš„ä¸–ç•Œä¹¦æ¡ç›®
        const prefixesToExclude_ACU = [
            'TavernDB-ACU-ReadableDataTable',     // å…¨å±€æ¡ç›®
            'é‡è¦äººç‰©æ¡ç›®',                       // é‡è¦äººç‰©æ¡ç›®
            'TavernDB-ACU-ImportantPersonsIndex'  // ç´¢å¼•
        ];
        allEntries = allEntries.filter(entry =>
            !entry.comment || !prefixesToExclude_ACU.some(prefix => entry.comment.startsWith(prefix))
        );

        if (allEntries.length === 0) {
            logDebug_ACU('Selected worldbooks contain no entries after filtering generated ones.');
            return '';
        }
        
        const enabledEntriesMap = worldbookConfig.enabledEntries || {};
        const userEnabledEntries = allEntries.filter(entry => {
            if (!entry.enabled) return false; // Filter out entries disabled in Tavern
            const bookConfig = enabledEntriesMap[entry.bookName];
            // Entry must be explicitly enabled in the plugin's UI settings
            return bookConfig ? bookConfig.includes(entry.uid) : false; 
        });

        if (userEnabledEntries.length === 0) {
            logDebug_ACU('No entries are enabled in the plugin settings.');
            return '';
        }
        
        // Use the already loaded chat messages
        const chatHistory = allChatMessages_ACU.map(message => message.message).join('
').toLowerCase();
        const getEntryKeywords = (entry) => [...new Set([...(entry.key || []), ...(entry.keys || [])])].map(k => k.toLowerCase());

        // Separate constant entries ("blue lights") from keyword-based ones ("green lights")
        const constantEntries = userEnabledEntries.filter(entry => entry.type === 'constant');
        let keywordEntries = userEnabledEntries.filter(entry => entry.type !== 'constant');
        
        const triggeredEntries = new Set([...constantEntries]);
        let recursionDepth = 0;
        const MAX_RECURSION_DEPTH = 10; // Safety break for infinite loops

        while (recursionDepth < MAX_RECURSION_DEPTH) {
            recursionDepth++;
            let hasChangedInThisPass = false;
            
            // The text to search within includes chat history AND the content of already triggered entries
            // that are NOT marked with prevent_recursion.
            const recursionSourceContent = Array.from(triggeredEntries)
                .filter(e => !e.prevent_recursion)
                .map(e => e.content)
                .join('
')
                .toLowerCase();
            const fullSearchText = `${chatHistory}
${recursionSourceContent}`;

            const remainingKeywordEntries = [];
            
            for (const entry of keywordEntries) {
                const keywords = getEntryKeywords(entry);
                // An entry is triggered if any of its keywords are found.
                // If exclude_recursion is true, search only in chat history.
                // Otherwise, search in the full text (history + triggered content).
                let isTriggered = keywords.length > 0 && keywords.some(keyword => 
                    entry.exclude_recursion ? chatHistory.includes(keyword) : fullSearchText.includes(keyword)
                );

                if (isTriggered) {
                    triggeredEntries.add(entry);
                    hasChangedInThisPass = true;
                } else {
                    remainingKeywordEntries.push(entry);
                }
            }
            
            // If no new entries were triggered in this full pass, the process is stable.
            if (!hasChangedInThisPass) {
                logDebug_ACU(`Worldbook recursion stabilized after ${recursionDepth} passes.`);
                break;
            }
            
            // Update the list of entries to check for the next pass.
            keywordEntries = remainingKeywordEntries;
        }

        if (recursionDepth >= MAX_RECURSION_DEPTH) {
            logWarn_ACU(`Worldbook recursion reached max depth of ${MAX_RECURSION_DEPTH}. Breaking loop.`);
        }

        const finalContent = Array.from(triggeredEntries).map(entry => {
            // Add a simple header for clarity
            return `### ${entry.comment || `Entry from ${entry.bookName}`}
${entry.content}`;
        }).filter(Boolean);

        if (finalContent.length === 0) {
            logDebug_ACU('No worldbook entries were ultimately triggered.');
            return '';
        }

        const combinedContent = finalContent.join('

');
        
        logDebug_ACU(`Combined worldbook content generated, length: ${combinedContent.length}. ${triggeredEntries.size} entries triggered.`);
        // Note: Character limit logic is omitted for now as it's not in the original settings.
        return combinedContent.trim();

    } catch (error) {
        logError_ACU(`[ACU] An error occurred while processing worldbook logic:`, error);
        return ''; // Return empty string on error to prevent breaking the generation.
    }
  }
  // --- [æ–°å¢] ä¸–ç•Œä¹¦ç›¸å…³åŠŸèƒ½ç»“æŸ ---

async function prepareAIInput_ACU(messages) {
    // This function is now simplified to only prepare the dynamic content parts.
    // The main prompt assembly will happen in callCustomOpenAI_ACU.
    if (!currentJsonTableData_ACU) {
        logError_ACU('prepareAIInput_ACU: Cannot prepare AI input, currentJsonTableData_ACU is null.');
        return null;
    }

    const worldbookContent = await getCombinedWorldbookContent_ACU();

    // 1. Format the current JSON table data into a human-readable text block for $0
    let tableDataText = '';
    const tableIndexes = Object.keys(currentJsonTableData_ACU).filter(k => k.startsWith('sheet_'));
    tableIndexes.forEach((sheetKey, tableIndex) => {
        const table = currentJsonTableData_ACU[sheetKey];
        if (!table || !table.name || !table.content) return;
        tableDataText += `[${tableIndex}:${table.name}]
`;
        const headers = table.content[0] ? table.content[0].slice(1).map((h, i) => `[${i}:${h}]`).join(', ') : 'No Headers';
        tableDataText += `  Columns: ${headers}
`;
        if (table.sourceData) {
            tableDataText += `  - Note: ${table.sourceData.note || 'N/A'}
`;
            tableDataText += `  - Insert Trigger: ${table.sourceData.insertNode || table.sourceData.initNode || 'N/A'}
`;
            tableDataText += `  - Update Trigger: ${table.sourceData.updateNode || 'N/A'}
`;
            tableDataText += `  - Delete Trigger: ${table.sourceData.deleteNode || 'N/A'}
`;
        }
        const allRows = table.content.slice(1);
        let rowsToProcess = allRows;
        let startIndex = 0;

        // [æ–°å¢] å¦‚æœæ˜¯å°æ€»ç»“è¡¨å¹¶ä¸”è¡Œæ•°è¶…è¿‡10ï¼Œåˆ™åªæå–æœ€æ–°çš„10æ¡
        if (table.name.trim() === 'å°æ€»ç»“' && allRows.length > 10) {
            startIndex = allRows.length - 10;
            rowsToProcess = allRows.slice(-10);
            tableDataText += `  - Note: Showing last ${rowsToProcess.length} of ${allRows.length} entries.
`;
        }

        if (rowsToProcess.length > 0) {
            rowsToProcess.forEach((row, index) => {
                const originalRowIndex = startIndex + index; // è®¡ç®—åŸå§‹è¡Œç´¢å¼•
                const rowData = row.slice(1).join(', ');
                tableDataText += `  [${originalRowIndex}] ${rowData}
`;
            });
        } else {
            tableDataText += '  (No data rows)
';
        }
        tableDataText += '
';
    });
    
    // 2. Format the messages for $1
    let messagesText = 'å½“å‰æœ€æ–°å¯¹è¯å†…å®¹:
';
    if (messages && messages.length > 0) {
        messagesText += messages.map(msg => {
            const prefix = msg.is_user ? SillyTavern_API_ACU?.name1 || 'ç”¨æˆ·' : msg.name || 'è§’è‰²';
            return `${prefix}: ${msg.message}`;
        }).join('
');
    } else {
        messagesText += '(æ— æœ€æ–°å¯¹è¯å†…å®¹)';
    }

    // Return the dynamic parts for interpolation.
    return { tableDataText, messagesText, worldbookContent };
}

async function callCustomOpenAI_ACU(dynamicContent) {
    // [æ–°å¢] åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªæ–°çš„ AbortController ç”¨äºæœ¬æ¬¡è¯·æ±‚
    currentAbortController_ACU = new AbortController();
    const abortSignal = currentAbortController_ACU.signal;

    // This function now assembles the final messages array.
    const messages = [];
    const charCardPromptSetting = settings_ACU.charCardPrompt;

    let promptSegments = [];
    if (Array.isArray(charCardPromptSetting)) {
        promptSegments = charCardPromptSetting;
    } else if (typeof charCardPromptSetting === 'string') {
        // Handle legacy single-string format
        promptSegments = [{ role: 'USER', content: charCardPromptSetting }];
    }

    // Interpolate placeholders in each segment
    promptSegments.forEach(segment => {
        let finalContent = segment.content;
        finalContent = finalContent.replace('$0', dynamicContent.tableDataText);
        finalContent = finalContent.replace('$1', dynamicContent.messagesText);
        finalContent = finalContent.replace('$4', dynamicContent.worldbookContent);
        
        // Convert role to lowercase for the API
        messages.push({ role: segment.role.toLowerCase(), content: finalContent });
    });

    // Add the final instruction for the AI
    
    logDebug_ACU('Final messages array being sent to API:', messages);

    if (settings_ACU.apiMode === 'tavern') {
        const profileId = settings_ACU.tavernProfile;
        if (!profileId) {
            throw new Error('æœªé€‰æ‹©é…’é¦†è¿æ¥é¢„è®¾ã€‚');
        }

        let originalProfile = '';
        let responsePromise;
        let rawResult;

        try {
            originalProfile = await TavernHelper_API_ACU.triggerSlash('/profile');
            const targetProfile = SillyTavern_API_ACU.extensionSettings?.connectionManager?.profiles.find(p => p.id === profileId);

            if (!targetProfile) {
                throw new Error(`æ— æ³•æ‰¾åˆ°IDä¸º "${profileId}" çš„è¿æ¥é¢„è®¾ã€‚`);
            }
            if (!targetProfile.api) {
                throw new Error(`é¢„è®¾ "${targetProfile.name || targetProfile.id}" æ²¡æœ‰é…ç½®APIã€‚`);
            }
            if (!targetProfile.preset) {
                throw new Error(`é¢„è®¾ "${targetProfile.name || targetProfile.id}" æ²¡æœ‰é€‰æ‹©é¢„è®¾ã€‚`);
            }

            const targetProfileName = targetProfile.name;
            const currentProfile = await TavernHelper_API_ACU.triggerSlash('/profile');

            if (currentProfile !== targetProfileName) {
                const escapedProfileName = targetProfileName.replace(/"/g, '\"');
                await TavernHelper_API_ACU.triggerSlash(`/profile await=true "${escapedProfileName}"`);
            }
            
            logDebug_ACU(`ACU: é€šè¿‡é…’é¦†è¿æ¥é¢„è®¾ (ID: ${profileId}, Name: ${targetProfileName}) å‘é€è¯·æ±‚...`);

            responsePromise = SillyTavern_API_ACU.ConnectionManagerRequestService.sendRequest(
                profileId, 
                messages, 
                // ä½¿ç”¨ max_tokens è®¾ç½®ï¼Œå¦‚æœä¸å­˜åœ¨åˆ™å›é€€åˆ°4096
                settings_ACU.apiConfig.max_tokens || 4096 
            );

        } catch (error) {
            logError_ACU(`ACU: è°ƒç”¨é…’é¦†è¿æ¥é¢„è®¾æ—¶å‡ºé”™:`, error);
            showToastr_ACU('error', `APIè¯·æ±‚å¤±è´¥ (é…’é¦†é¢„è®¾): ${error.message}`);
            responsePromise = Promise.resolve(null); // ç¡®ä¿ responsePromise æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªå€¼
        } finally {
            const currentProfileAfterCall = await TavernHelper_API_ACU.triggerSlash('/profile');
            if (originalProfile && originalProfile !== currentProfileAfterCall) {
                const escapedOriginalProfile = originalProfile.replace(/"/g, '\"');
                await TavernHelper_API_ACU.triggerSlash(`/profile await=true "${escapedOriginalProfile}"`);
                logDebug_ACU(`ACU: å·²æ¢å¤åŸé…’é¦†è¿æ¥é¢„è®¾: "${originalProfile}"`);
            }
        }
        
        rawResult = await responsePromise;

        if (rawResult && rawResult.ok && rawResult.result?.choices?.[0]?.message?.content) {
            return rawResult.result.choices[0].message.content.trim();
        } else if (rawResult && typeof rawResult.content === 'string') {
            return rawResult.content.trim();
        } else {
            const errorMsg = rawResult?.error || JSON.stringify(rawResult);
            throw new Error(`é…’é¦†é¢„è®¾APIè°ƒç”¨è¿”å›æ— æ•ˆå“åº”: ${errorMsg}`);
        }

    } else { // 'custom' mode
        // --- ä½¿ç”¨è‡ªå®šä¹‰API ---
        if (settings_ACU.apiConfig.useMainApi) {
            // æ¨¡å¼A: ä½¿ç”¨ä¸»API
            logDebug_ACU('ACU: é€šè¿‡é…’é¦†ä¸»APIå‘é€è¯·æ±‚...');
            if (typeof TavernHelper_API_ACU.generateRaw !== 'function') {
                throw new Error('TavernHelper.generateRaw å‡½æ•°ä¸å­˜åœ¨ã€‚è¯·æ£€æŸ¥é…’é¦†ç‰ˆæœ¬ã€‚');
            }
            const response = await TavernHelper_API_ACU.generateRaw({
                ordered_prompts: messages,
                should_stream: false, // æ•°æ®åº“æ›´æ–°ä¸éœ€è¦æµå¼è¾“å‡º
            });
            if (typeof response !== 'string') {
                throw new Error('ä¸»APIè°ƒç”¨æœªè¿”å›é¢„æœŸçš„æ–‡æœ¬å“åº”ã€‚');
            }
            return response.trim();

        } else {
            // æ¨¡å¼B: ä½¿ç”¨ç‹¬ç«‹é…ç½®çš„API
            if (!settings_ACU.apiConfig.url || !settings_ACU.apiConfig.model) {
                throw new Error('è‡ªå®šä¹‰APIçš„URLæˆ–æ¨¡å‹æœªé…ç½®ã€‚');
            }
            const generateUrl = `/api/backends/chat-completions/generate`;
            
            const headers = { ...SillyTavern.getRequestHeaders(), 'Content-Type': 'application/json' };
            
            const body = JSON.stringify({
              "messages": messages,
              "model": settings_ACU.apiConfig.model,
              "temperature": settings_ACU.apiConfig.temperature,
              "frequency_penalty": 0,
              "presence_penalty": 0.12,
              "top_p": settings_ACU.apiConfig.top_p || 0.9,
              "max_tokens": settings_ACU.apiConfig.max_tokens,
              "stream": false,
              "chat_completion_source": "custom",
              "group_names": [],
              "include_reasoning": false,
              "reasoning_effort": "medium",
              "enable_web_search": false,
              "request_images": false,
              "custom_prompt_post_processing": "strict",
              "reverse_proxy": settings_ACU.apiConfig.url,
              "proxy_password": "",
              "custom_url": settings_ACU.apiConfig.url,
              "custom_include_headers": settings_ACU.apiConfig.apiKey ? `Authorization: Bearer ${settings_ACU.apiConfig.apiKey}` : ""
            });
            
            logDebug_ACU('ACU: è°ƒç”¨æ–°çš„åç«¯ç”ŸæˆAPI:', generateUrl, 'Model:', settings_ACU.apiConfig.model);
            const response = await fetch(generateUrl, { method: 'POST', headers, body, signal: abortSignal });
            
            if (!response.ok) {
              const errTxt = await response.text();
              throw new Error(`APIè¯·æ±‚å¤±è´¥: ${response.status} ${errTxt}`);
            }
            
            const data = await response.json();
            // The new backend API returns the content directly in the response
            if (data && data.choices && data.choices[0] && data.choices[0].message && data.choices[0].message.content) {
                return data.choices[0].message.content.trim();
            }
            throw new Error('APIå“åº”æ ¼å¼ä¸æ­£ç¡®æˆ–å†…å®¹ä¸ºç©ºã€‚');
        }
    }
  }

  function parseAndApplyTableEdits_ACU(aiResponse) {
    if (!currentJsonTableData_ACU) {
        logError_ACU('Cannot apply edits, currentJsonTableData_ACU is not loaded.');
        return false;
    }

    // [æ–°å¢] é’ˆå¯¹AIå¯èƒ½è¿”å›çš„JSå­—ç¬¦ä¸²æ ¼å¼è¿›è¡Œæ¸…ç†
    let cleanedResponse = aiResponse.trim();
    // ç§»é™¤JSé£æ ¼çš„å­—ç¬¦ä¸²æ‹¼æ¥å’Œè½¬ä¹‰
    // ä¾‹å¦‚: '<tableEdit>...' + '...'
    cleanedResponse = cleanedResponse.replace(/'\s*\+\s*'/g, '');
    // ç§»é™¤å¯èƒ½åŒ…è£¹æ•´ä¸ªå“åº”çš„å•å¼•å·
    if (cleanedResponse.startsWith("'") && cleanedResponse.endsWith("'")) {
        cleanedResponse = cleanedResponse.slice(1, -1);
    }
    // å°† "\n" è½¬æ¢ä¸ºçœŸå®çš„æ¢è¡Œç¬¦
    cleanedResponse = cleanedResponse.replace(/\n/g, '
');
    // [FIX] ä¿®å¤ç”±JSå­—ç¬¦ä¸²è½¬ä¹‰ç¬¦ï¼ˆ\ï¼‰å¯¼è‡´çš„è§£æå¤±è´¥ï¼Œå°†'\"'è½¬æ¢ä¸º'"'
    cleanedResponse = cleanedResponse.replace(/\\"/g, '\"');

    const editBlockMatch = cleanedResponse.match(/<tableEdit>([\s\S]*?)</tableEdit>/);
    if (!editBlockMatch || !editBlockMatch[1]) {
        logWarn_ACU('No valid <tableEdit> block found in AI response.');
        return true; // Not a failure, just no edits to apply.
    }

    const editsString = editBlockMatch[1].replace(/<!--|-->/g, '').trim();
    if (!editsString) {
        logDebug_ACU('Empty <tableEdit> block. No edits to apply.');
        return true;
    }
    
    // [æ ¸å¿ƒä¿®å¤] å¢åŠ æŒ‡ä»¤é‡ç»„æ­¥éª¤ï¼Œå¤„ç†AIç”Ÿæˆçš„å¤šè¡ŒæŒ‡ä»¤
    const originalLines = editsString.split('
');
    const commandLines = [];
    let commandReconstructor = '';

    originalLines.forEach(line => {
        const trimmedLine = line.trim();
        if (trimmedLine === '') return;

        // å¦‚æœä¸€è¡Œä»¥æŒ‡ä»¤å¼€å¤´ï¼Œå°±å¤„ç†ä¹‹å‰ç¼“å­˜çš„æŒ‡ä»¤ï¼Œå¹¶å¼€å§‹ç¼“å­˜æ–°æŒ‡ä»¤
        if (trimmedLine.startsWith('insertRow') || trimmedLine.startsWith('deleteRow') || trimmedLine.startsWith('updateRow')) {
            if (commandReconstructor) {
                commandLines.push(commandReconstructor);
            }
            commandReconstructor = trimmedLine;
        } else {
            // å¦‚æœä¸æ˜¯æŒ‡ä»¤å¼€å¤´ï¼Œè¯´æ˜æ˜¯ä¸Šä¸€æ¡æŒ‡ä»¤çš„å»¶ç»­ï¼Œæ‹¼æ¥åˆ°ç¼“å­˜
            commandReconstructor += trimmedLine;
        }
    });

    // å°†æœ€åä¸€æ¡ç¼“å­˜çš„æŒ‡ä»¤æ¨å…¥
    if (commandReconstructor) {
        commandLines.push(commandReconstructor);
    }
    
    let appliedEdits = 0;

    const sheets = Object.keys(currentJsonTableData_ACU)
                         .filter(k => k.startsWith('sheet_'))
                         .map(k => currentJsonTableData_ACU[k]);

    commandLines.forEach(line => {
        // [ç¨³å¥æ€§å¼ºåŒ–] ç§»é™¤è¡Œå°¾çš„æ³¨é‡Š
        const commandLineWithoutComment = line.split('//')[0].trim();
        if (!commandLineWithoutComment) {
            return; // è·³è¿‡ç©ºè¡Œæˆ–åªæœ‰æ³¨é‡Šçš„è¡Œ
        }

        // æ¢å¤ä½¿ç”¨æ­£åˆ™è¡¨è¾¾å¼æ¥è§£ææŒ‡ä»¤ï¼Œè¿™å¯¹äºå¤æ‚å‚æ•°æ›´ç¨³å¥
        const match = commandLineWithoutComment.match(/^(insertRow|deleteRow|updateRow)\s*\((.*)\);?$/);
        if (!match) {
            logWarn_ACU(`Skipping malformed or truncated command line: "${commandLineWithoutComment}"`);
            return; // continue to next line
        }

        const command = match[1];
        const argsString = match[2];
        
        try {
            // [æ ¸å¿ƒä¿®å¤] æ›´ç¨³å¥çš„å‚æ•°åˆ†å‰²å’ŒJSONè§£æ
            const firstBracket = argsString.indexOf('{');
            let args;

            if (firstBracket === -1) {
                // æ²¡æœ‰JSONå¯¹è±¡ï¼Œæ˜¯ç®€å•çš„deleteRowæŒ‡ä»¤
                args = JSON.parse(`[${argsString}]`);
            } else {
                // åŒ…å«JSONå¯¹è±¡çš„æŒ‡ä»¤ (insertRow, updateRow)
                const paramsPart = argsString.substring(0, firstBracket).trim();
                const jsonPart = argsString.substring(firstBracket);

                // è§£æå‰é¢çš„å‚æ•°ï¼ˆtableIndex, rowIndexç­‰ï¼‰ï¼Œç§»é™¤å°¾éƒ¨é€—å·
                const initialArgs = JSON.parse(`[${paramsPart.replace(/,$/, '')}]`);
                
                // å¯¹JSONéƒ¨åˆ†è¿›è¡Œå•ç‹¬ã€å®‰å…¨çš„è§£æ
                try {
                    const jsonData = JSON.parse(jsonPart);
                    args = [...initialArgs, jsonData];
                } catch (jsonError) {
                    logError_ACU(`Primary JSON parse failed for: "${jsonPart}". Attempting sanitization...`, jsonError);
                    // å¦‚æœæ ‡å‡†è§£æå¤±è´¥ï¼Œå°è¯•è¿›è¡Œæ¸…ç†
                    // è¿™ä¸ªæ­£åˆ™è¡¨è¾¾å¼ä¼šæŸ¥æ‰¾JSONå­—ç¬¦ä¸²å€¼ï¼Œå¹¶å°†å…¶ä¸­çš„ " æ›¿æ¢ä¸º "
                    // å®ƒèƒ½å¤„ç†å·²è½¬ä¹‰çš„å¼•å·ï¼Œé¿å…é‡å¤è½¬ä¹‰
                    const sanitizedJsonPart = jsonPart.replace(/(:\s*)"((?:\.|[^"\])*)"/g, (match, prefix, content) => {
                        const sanitizedContent = content.replace(/(?<!\)"/g, '\"');
                        return `${prefix}"${sanitizedContent}"`;
                    });
                     if(sanitizedJsonPart !== jsonPart) {
                         logDebug_ACU(`Sanitized JSON part: "${sanitizedJsonPart}"`);
                         const jsonData = JSON.parse(sanitizedJsonPart);
                         args = [...initialArgs, jsonData];
                     } else {
                         throw jsonError; // å¦‚æœæ¸…ç†åæ²¡å˜åŒ–ï¼Œåˆ™é‡æ–°æŠ›å‡ºåŸå§‹é”™è¯¯
                     }
                }
            }


            switch (command) {
                case 'insertRow': {
                    const [tableIndex, data] = args;
                    const table = sheets[tableIndex];
                    if (table && table.content && typeof data === 'object') {
                        const newRow = [null];
                        const headers = table.content[0].slice(1);
                        headers.forEach((_, colIndex) => {
                            newRow.push(data[colIndex] || (data[String(colIndex)] || ""));
                        });
                        table.content.push(newRow);
                        logDebug_ACU(`Applied insertRow to table ${tableIndex} (${table.name}) with data:`, data);
                        appliedEdits++;
                    }
                    break;
                }
                case 'deleteRow': {
                    const [tableIndex, rowIndex] = args;
                    const table = sheets[tableIndex];
                    if (table && table.content && table.content.length > rowIndex + 1) {
                        table.content.splice(rowIndex + 1, 1);
                        logDebug_ACU(`Applied deleteRow to table ${tableIndex} (${table.name}) at index ${rowIndex}`);
                        appliedEdits++;
                    }
                    break;
                }
                case 'updateRow': {
                    const [tableIndex, rowIndex, data] = args;
                    const table = sheets[tableIndex];
                    if (table && table.content && table.content.length > rowIndex + 1 && typeof data === 'object') {
                        Object.keys(data).forEach(colIndexStr => {
                            const colIndex = parseInt(colIndexStr, 10);
                            if (!isNaN(colIndex) && table.content[rowIndex + 1].length > colIndex + 1) {
                                table.content[rowIndex + 1][colIndex + 1] = data[colIndexStr];
                            }
                        });
                        logDebug_ACU(`Applied updateRow to table ${tableIndex} (${table.name}) at index ${rowIndex} with data:`, data);
                        appliedEdits++;
                    }
                    break;
                }
            }
        } catch (e) {
            logError_ACU(`Failed to parse or apply command: "${line}"`, e);
        }
    });
    
    showToastr_ACU('info', `ä»AIå“åº”ä¸­æˆåŠŸåº”ç”¨äº† ${appliedEdits} ä¸ªæ•°æ®åº“æ›´æ–°ã€‚`);
    return true;
}

  async function proceedWithCardUpdate_ACU(messagesToUse) {
    if (!$statusMessageSpan_ACU && $popupInstance_ACU)
        $statusMessageSpan_ACU = $popupInstance_ACU.find(`#${SCRIPT_ID_PREFIX_ACU}-status-message`);

    const statusUpdate = (text) => {
        if ($statusMessageSpan_ACU) $statusMessageSpan_ACU.text(text);
    };

    let loadingToast = null;
    let success = false;
    const maxRetries = 3;

    try {
        topLevelWindow_ACU.AutoCardUpdaterAPI._notifyTableFillStart();
        
        const stopButtonHtml = `
            <button id="acu-stop-update-btn" 
                    style="border: 1px solid #ffc107; color: #ffc107; background: transparent; padding: 5px 10px; border-radius: 4px; cursor: pointer; float: right; margin-left: 15px; font-size: 0.9em; transition: all 0.2s ease;"
                    onmouseover="this.style.backgroundColor='#ffc107'; this.style.color='#1a1d24';"
                    onmouseout="this.style.backgroundColor='transparent'; this.style.color='#ffc107';">
                ç»ˆæ­¢
            </button>`;
        const toastMessage = `<div>æ­£åœ¨å¡«è¡¨ï¼Œè¯·ç¨å€™...${stopButtonHtml}</div>`;
        
        loadingToast = showToastr_ACU('info', toastMessage, { 
            timeOut: 0, 
            extendedTimeOut: 0, 
            tapToDismiss: false,
            onShown: function() {
                const $stopButton = jQuery_API_ACU('#acu-stop-update-btn');
                if ($stopButton.length) {
                    $stopButton.off('click.acu_stop').on('click.acu_stop', function(e) {
                        e.stopPropagation();
                        e.preventDefault();

                        // [ä¿®å¤] è®¾ç½®æ ‡å¿—ï¼Œå‘ŠçŸ¥äº‹ä»¶ç›‘å¬å™¨æœ¬æ¬¡æ›´æ–°æ˜¯ç”¨æˆ·æ‰‹åŠ¨ç»ˆæ­¢çš„
                        wasStoppedByUser_ACU = true;

                        // 1. Abort network requests
                        if (currentAbortController_ACU) {
                            currentAbortController_ACU.abort();
                        }
                        if (SillyTavern_API_ACU && typeof SillyTavern_API_ACU.stopGeneration === 'function') {
                            SillyTavern_API_ACU.stopGeneration();
                            logDebug_ACU('Called SillyTavern_API_ACU.stopGeneration()');
                        }
                        
                        // 2. Immediately reset UI state
                        isAutoUpdatingCard_ACU = false;
                        if ($manualUpdateCardButton_ACU) {
                            $manualUpdateCardButton_ACU.prop('disabled', false).text('ç«‹å³æ›´æ–°æ•°æ®åº“');
                        }
                        if ($statusMessageSpan_ACU) {
                             $statusMessageSpan_ACU.text('æ“ä½œå·²ç»ˆæ­¢ã€‚');
                        }

                        // 3. Remove toast and show confirmation
                        jQuery_API_ACU(this).closest('.toast').remove();
                        showToastr_ACU('warning', 'å¡«è¡¨æ“ä½œå·²ç”±ç”¨æˆ·ç»ˆæ­¢ã€‚');
                    });
                } else {
                    logError_ACU('Could not find the stop button in the toast.');
                }
            }
        });

        statusUpdate('å‡†å¤‡AIè¾“å…¥...');
        const dynamicContent = await prepareAIInput_ACU(messagesToUse);
        if (!dynamicContent) throw new Error('æ— æ³•å‡†å¤‡AIè¾“å…¥ï¼Œæ•°æ®åº“æœªåŠ è½½ã€‚');

        for (let attempt = 1; attempt <= maxRetries; attempt++) {
            statusUpdate(`ç¬¬ ${attempt}/${maxRetries} æ¬¡è°ƒç”¨AIè¿›è¡Œå¢é‡æ›´æ–°...`);
            const aiResponse = await callCustomOpenAI_ACU(dynamicContent);

            if (currentAbortController_ACU.signal.aborted) {
                 throw new DOMException('Aborted by user', 'AbortError');
            }

            if (!aiResponse || !aiResponse.includes('<tableEdit>') || !aiResponse.includes('</tableEdit>')) {
                logWarn_ACU(`ç¬¬ ${attempt} æ¬¡å°è¯•å¤±è´¥ï¼šAIå“åº”ä¸­æœªæ‰¾åˆ°å®Œæ•´æœ‰æ•ˆçš„ <tableEdit> æ ‡ç­¾ã€‚`);
                if (attempt === maxRetries) {
                    throw new Error(`AIåœ¨ ${maxRetries} æ¬¡å°è¯•åä»æœªèƒ½è¿”å›æœ‰æ•ˆæŒ‡ä»¤ã€‚`);
                }
                await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000)); // ç­‰å¾…1ç§’åé‡è¯•
                continue;
            }

            statusUpdate('è§£æå¹¶åº”ç”¨AIè¿”å›çš„æ›´æ–°...');
            const parseSuccess = parseAndApplyTableEdits_ACU(aiResponse);
            if (!parseSuccess) throw new Error('è§£ææˆ–åº”ç”¨AIæ›´æ–°æ—¶å‡ºé”™ã€‚');
            
            success = true;
            break; 
        }

        if (success) {
            statusUpdate('æ­£åœ¨å°†æ›´æ–°åçš„æ•°æ®åº“ä¿å­˜åˆ°èŠå¤©è®°å½•...');
            const saveSuccess = await saveJsonTableToChatHistory_ACU();
            if (!saveSuccess) throw new Error('æ— æ³•å°†æ›´æ–°åçš„æ•°æ®åº“ä¿å­˜åˆ°èŠå¤©è®°å½•ã€‚');
            
            await updateReadableLorebookEntry_ACU(true);

            setTimeout(() => {
                topLevelWindow_ACU.AutoCardUpdaterAPI._notifyTableUpdate();
                logDebug_ACU('Delayed notification sent after saving.');
            }, 250);
            
            statusUpdate('æ•°æ®åº“å¢é‡æ›´æ–°æˆåŠŸï¼');
            if (typeof updateCardUpdateStatusDisplay_ACU === 'function') {
                updateCardUpdateStatusDisplay_ACU();
            }
        }
        return success;

    } catch (error) {
        if (error.name === 'AbortError') {
            logDebug_ACU('Fetch request was aborted by the user.');
            // UI state is now reset in the click handler, so we just need to log and return
        } else {
            logError_ACU(`æ•°æ®åº“å¢é‡æ›´æ–°æµç¨‹å¤±è´¥: ${error.message}`);
            showToastr_ACU('error', `æ›´æ–°å¤±è´¥: ${error.message}`);
            statusUpdate('é”™è¯¯ï¼šæ›´æ–°å¤±è´¥ã€‚');
        }
        return false;
    } finally {
        // The toast is removed by the click handler on abort, so this only clears it on success/error
        if (loadingToast && toastr_API_ACU) {
            toastr_API_ACU.clear(loadingToast);
        }
        currentAbortController_ACU = null;
        // Ensure state is always reset when the function exits, for any reason.
        isAutoUpdatingCard_ACU = false; 
        if ($manualUpdateCardButton_ACU) {
            $manualUpdateCardButton_ACU.prop('disabled', false).text('ç«‹å³æ›´æ–°æ•°æ®åº“');
        }
    }
  }

  async function handleManualUpdateCard_ACU() {
    if (isAutoUpdatingCard_ACU) {
      showToastr_ACU('info', 'å·²æœ‰æ›´æ–°ä»»åŠ¡åœ¨åå°è¿›è¡Œä¸­ã€‚');
      return;
    }
    
    const apiIsConfigured = (settings_ACU.apiMode === 'custom' && (settings_ACU.apiConfig.useMainApi || (settings_ACU.apiConfig.url && settings_ACU.apiConfig.model))) || (settings_ACU.apiMode === 'tavern' && settings_ACU.tavernProfile);

    if (!apiIsConfigured) {
      showToastr_ACU('warning', 'è¯·å…ˆå®Œæˆå½“å‰APIæ¨¡å¼çš„é…ç½®ã€‚');
      if ($popupInstance_ACU && $apiConfigAreaDiv_ACU && $apiConfigAreaDiv_ACU.is(':hidden')) {
        if ($apiConfigSectionToggle_ACU) $apiConfigSectionToggle_ACU.trigger('click');
      }
      return;
    }

    isAutoUpdatingCard_ACU = true;
    if ($manualUpdateCardButton_ACU) $manualUpdateCardButton_ACU.prop('disabled', true).text('æ›´æ–°ä¸­...');

    // ä¿®å¤ï¼šåœ¨æ‰‹åŠ¨æ›´æ–°å‰ï¼Œå¼ºåˆ¶é‡æ–°åŠ è½½æ•°æ®åº“ï¼Œç¡®ä¿æ•°æ®ä¸æ˜¯null
    await loadOrCreateJsonTableFromChatHistory_ACU();
    await loadAllChatMessages_ACU();
    const currentThreshold = getEffectiveAutoUpdateThreshold_ACU('manual_update');
    const messagesToProcess = allChatMessages_ACU.slice(-currentThreshold);

    const success = await proceedWithCardUpdate_ACU(messagesToProcess);

    isAutoUpdatingCard_ACU = false;
    if ($manualUpdateCardButton_ACU) $manualUpdateCardButton_ACU.prop('disabled', false).text('ç«‹å³æ›´æ–°æ•°æ®åº“');
  }

  }

    }

  function importTableTemplate_ACU() {
    const input = document.createElement('input');
    input.type = 'file';
    input.accept = '.json';
    input.onchange = e => {
        const file = e.target.files[0];
        if (!file) return;

        const reader = new FileReader();
        reader.onload = async (readerEvent) => { // Make the onload async
            const content = readerEvent.target.result;
            let jsonData;

            try {
                jsonData = JSON.parse(content);
            } catch (error) {
                logError_ACU('å¯¼å…¥æ¨¡æ¿å¤±è´¥ï¼šJSONè§£æé”™è¯¯ã€‚', error);
                let errorMessage = 'æ–‡ä»¶ä¸æ˜¯æœ‰æ•ˆçš„JSONæ ¼å¼ã€‚è¯·æ£€æŸ¥æ˜¯å¦å­˜åœ¨å¤šä½™çš„é€—å·ã€ç¼ºå¤±çš„æ‹¬å·æˆ–ä¸æ­£ç¡®çš„å¼•å·ã€‚';
                if (error.message) {
                    errorMessage += ` (é”™è¯¯è¯¦æƒ…: ${error.message})`;
                }
                showToastr_ACU('error', errorMessage, { timeOut: 10000 });
                return;
            }
            
            try {
                // æ·±å…¥çš„ç»“æ„éªŒè¯
                if (!jsonData.mate || !jsonData.mate.type || jsonData.mate.type !== 'chatSheets') {
                    throw new Error('ç¼ºå°‘ "mate" å¯¹è±¡æˆ– "type" å±æ€§ä¸æ­£ç¡®ã€‚æ¨¡æ¿å¿…é¡»åŒ…å« `"mate": {"type": "chatSheets", ...}`ã€‚');
                }

                const sheetKeys = Object.keys(jsonData).filter(k => k.startsWith('sheet_'));
                if (sheetKeys.length === 0) {
                    throw new Error('æ¨¡æ¿ä¸­æœªæ‰¾åˆ°ä»»ä½•è¡¨æ ¼æ•°æ® (ç¼ºå°‘ "sheet_..." é”®)ã€‚');
                }

                for (const key of sheetKeys) {
                    const sheet = jsonData[key];
                    if (!sheet.name || !sheet.content || !sheet.sourceData || !Array.isArray(sheet.content)) {

## Core Essence
A large-scale romantic style shaped by inevitability, distance, and the quiet pull of two lives moving toward a single point. Emotion gathers through long paragraphs and long sentences that move with steady force, without metaphors, without explanation, without decorative passion. Characters act with clarity and purpose; their choices create the sense of destiny, not any dramatic label. The prose stays clean, grounded, and luminous, letting the worldâ€™s scale and the charactersâ€™ persistence build the feeling of something that was always meant to happen.

## Core Elements
1. Long, continuous paragraphs that move like slow gravity.  
2. Clean language without metaphor, symbolism, or lyrical excess.  
3. Emotion shown through timing, arrival, endurance, and return.  
4. Scenes built with distanceâ€”roads, horizons, night crossings, quiet thresholds.  
5. Characters steady, sincere, and unperformative.  
6. No declarations; fate is carried by action, not words.  
7. Tension created by proximity, delay, silence, and choice.  

## Influential Authors
### International
- Madeline Miller  
- Maggie Oâ€™Farrell  
- Ocean Vuong  
- Hanya Yanagihara  
- Kazuo Ishiguro  
- Donna Tartt  
- Michael Ondaatje  
- James Baldwin  
- Joan Didion  
- Elena Ferrante  
- Sally Rooney  
- Marilynne Robinson  
- Richard Powers  

### East Asian & Chinese

### Web Authors with Clean Gravity

## Tone & Rhythm
Long sentences flow with controlled inevitability; short ones strike when the emotional axis shifts. The tone remains clear, patient, and unforced. Paragraphs stretch to contain breath, distance, and timeâ€”never fragmented for effect. Emotion builds from persistence, presence, and the slow closing of space.

## Dialogue Guidelines
- Simple, direct lines that hold weight through timing.  
- Silence used as response rather than dramatic pause.  
- No rhetorical flourish, no poetic confession.  
- Words arrive late, lightly, and precisely.  
- Dialogue carries inevitability through steadiness, not intensity.  

## Atmospheric Tendencies
Night roads, long walkways, train platforms, high places with wind, quiet apartments with open doors, places where time feels widened. Weather remains simple and grounded: steady rain, cold air, muted dawn, clean night. Light shifts clearlyâ€”no symbolism, only the world turning.

## Techniques for Execution
- Begin scenes with movement: returning, approaching, pausing at a threshold.  
- Let destiny appear through repetition and return.  
- Keep emotions in action, not reflection.  
- Build tension by maintaining distance before closing it.  
- Use long paragraphs to sustain inevitability; avoid explanatory transitions.  
- End on continuation: a step, a breath, a decision, a door slightly open.  

## Binding Sentence
> Overall mood: clean, steady inevitabilityâ€”romance shaped by distance, persistence, and the quiet certainty that two lives are moving toward the same horizon.

prompts.name: æ–‡é£ï¼šæ’æ¸©æµªæ¼«
prompts.content:
<writing_style:æ’æ¸©æµªæ¼«>

## Core Essence
A soft, steady, spacious form of romance that grows through presence, patience, and the quiet alignment of two people moving at the same pace. Paragraphs are long, continuous, and unbroken; sentences follow natural breath instead of dramatic rhythm. The writing avoids metaphors, avoids explanation, avoids ornamental sweetness. Romance appears through attention, timing, and the way two people adjust to each other's existence without performing it.

## Core Principles
1. Long paragraphs with stable rhythm; no abrupt breaks.
2. Language clean and plain, never sugary, never theatrical.
3. Emotion shown through proximity, pauses, shared routine, and quiet cooperation.
4. No metaphors, no moral labels, no emotional definitions.
5. Romantic tension carried by small, lived actions: handing a cup, opening a window, adjusting the pace of a walk.
6. Characters stay sincere, grounded, respectful; no dominance, no teasing meant to impress.
7. The world is presented through temperature, light, and movement rather than symbolic imagery.

## Emotional Logic
- Romance grows from constancy, not intensity.
- Closeness forms when two people choose not to hurry.
- Warmth stays low-key, carried by gesture, timing, and quiet acknowledgment.
- Desire is quiet and physical in the simplest sense: leaning slightly closer, slowing down, letting silence stay.
- No declaration; only action.

## Dialogue Guidelines
- Lines are brief, natural, unforced.
- Replies follow understanding, not performance.
- No flirtation tropes, no suggestive teasing, no poetic declarations.
- Silence is allowed to hold the emotional center of a scene.

## Scene Tendencies
- Light falling across a table.
- Two people cooking slowly in the same room.
- Someone returning with a warm drink.
- Shared walking pace on an evening street.
- Everyday spaces that feel lived, warm, and open.

## Writing Techniques
- Begin with an action, not a feeling.
- Let physical detail reveal emotional direction.
- Maintain long, steady sentences with minimal punctuation.
- Let small gestures replace internal monologue.
- End scenes on a lingering action, not a conclusion or statement.

## Influential Authors (names only)
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe  
Friedrich Schiller  
Lord Byron  
Percy Bysshe Shelley  
John Keats  
William Wordsworth  
Samuel Taylor Coleridge  
Novalis  
Heinrich Heine  
Victor Hugo  
Alfred de Musset  
Alphonse de Lamartine  
Alexander Pushkin  
Mikhail Lermontov  
Ivan Turgenev  

## Binding Sentence
Romance stays warm, low, steady, and unmistakableâ€”carried by long paragraphs, quiet actions, clean language, and the simple decision to remain present without performing love.

</writing_style:æ’æ¸©æµªæ¼«>

<writing_style:ä¹¦æ–‹æœ¬çºª>

## Core Essence
A composed, clear, and quietly persistent narrative shaped by the habits of someone who reads, observes, and thinks before speaking. Language remains steady and unadorned; paragraphs move in long, continuous lines of thought without metaphor, explanation, or emotional labeling. Characters stay grounded, respectful, and self-contained, revealing themselves through deliberate actions, small adjustments, and the cadence of their replies.

## Core Elements
1. Long paragraphs with uninterrupted flow.  
2. Complex long sentences guided by logic and observation.  
3. No metaphors, no emotional definitions, no analytical explanation.  
4. Characters reveal intention through routine behavior and precise speech.  
5. Emotional tone shown through timing, distance, and restraint.  
6. Environment simple and ordered: papers, books, windows, muted light.  
7. Story progresses through decisions, tasks, and quiet attention.

## Influential Authors
- J. M. Coetzee  
- Kazuo Ishiguro  
- Annie Ernaux  
- Rachel Cusk  
- Jhumpa Lahiri  
- Susan Sontag
- Octavia Butlerï¼ˆdiscipline of actionï¼‰  
- ç‹å®‰å¿†
- æ²ˆä»æ–‡
- æœ¨å¿ƒ
- é˜¿åŸ
- åŒ—å²›
- è¿Ÿå­å»º
- ä¸‰æ¯›
- ä¸æŸ“ã€é•¿æ´±ã€å°¾é±¼

## Tone & Rhythm
The tone remains calm, sincere, and measured. Long sentences hold thought in a single breath; short ones intervene only when the moment requires clarity. No elevated emotion, no dramatic push. The narration stands close to the characters without invading their inner commentary.

## Dialogue Guidelines
- Speak only what is necessary.  
- Keep replies direct, brief, and respectful.  
- Let pauses and small delays reveal the emotional temperature.  
- No flirtation, no performative warmth, no rhetorical declarations.  
- Dialogue follows the pattern: perceive â†’ confirm â†’ respond.

## Scene & Atmosphere
Rooms with papers stacked neatly, a cup placed beside an open book, the muted sound of someone turning a page, light settling against shelves. Everyday order acts as quiet background. No theatrical staging; no symbolic objects; only what is used.

## Behavioral Principles
1. Characters never assume the otherâ€™s emotions or thoughts.  
2. Every gesture stays within boundaries.  
3. Care shown through small, practical actsâ€”not intensity.  
4. Quiet listening over dramatic reassurance.  
5. Movement deliberate, steady, grounded.

## Techniques for Execution
- Begin with an action or small task, not interpretation.  
- Let long sentences follow the natural chain of perception.  
- Keep emotional content in rhythm and breath, not adjectives.  
- Use objects as practical tools, not symbols.  
- End on a concrete detail that closes the moment without summarizing.

## Binding Sentence
> Overall mood: calm, ordered, and quietly attentiveâ€”long paragraphs, disciplined language, and characters whose sincerity appears through steady actions rather than emotional display.

</writing_style:ä¹¦æ–‹æœ¬çºª>

prompts.name: æ–‡é£ï¼šæ—é—´å¸¸å…‰
prompts.content:
<writing_style:æ—é—´å¸¸å…‰>

## Core Essence
A clean, steady, breathable narrative shaped by real movement, real light, and the quiet presence of people who do not perform. Emotion stays in action and timing; the prose avoids metaphors, avoids explanation, avoids moral commentary. Long paragraphs flow in one continuous breath, allowing scenes to expand with natural rhythm. Characters remain grounded, respectful, self-contained, and their closeness comes from consistency rather than gesture.

## Core Elements
1. Long paragraphs built from continuous observation and action.  
2. Long sentences that follow movement, not analysis.  
3. No metaphors, no symbolic framing, no emotional labels.  
4. Characters shown through pace, posture, and choice.  
5. Scenes led by natural light, sound, temperature, and physical presence.  
6. Dialogue minimal and calm, shaped by real timing.  
7. Story progression driven by everyday decisions rather than dramatized events.  

## Influential Authors
**å›½é™…å‚è€ƒ**ï¼šAnnie Ernauxã€Rachel Cuskã€Sally Rooneyã€Raymond Carverã€Jhumpa Lahiriã€Kazuo Ishiguroã€Haruki Murakamiã€Alice Munroã€‚  
**ä¸­æ–‡å‚è€ƒ**ï¼šæ±ªæ›¾ç¥ºã€ç‹å®‰å¿†ã€è¿Ÿå­å»ºã€é˜¿åŸã€å¼ çˆ±ç²ã€æ²ˆä»æ–‡ã€éª†ä»¥å†›ã€ç¬›å®‰ã€åŒé›ªæ¶›ã€‚  
**ç½‘æ–‡å‚è€ƒï¼ˆå¹²å‡€ç°å®ç³»ï¼‰**ï¼šæœ¨æµ®ç”Ÿã€ Twentineã€ç–æœˆæ™ï¼ˆæ—©æœŸç°å®å‘ï¼‰ã€è¾¹æƒ³ã€æ‰¶ä»–æŸ æª¬èŒ¶ã€‚  

## Tone & Rhythm
Long sentences shape a steady flow; short lines appear only when the scene interrupts itself. Tone stays quiet, direct, and restrained. The rhythm holds the feeling of someone walking through a forest pathâ€”constant, unforced, with small shifts of air and sound guiding attention.

## Language Guidelines
- No metaphors or symbolic language.  
- No definitions of emotion; no explaining what a character feels.  
- Use sensory detail only as it occurs in the scene.  
- Let actions replace internal commentary.  
- Maintain long, continuous paragraphs to keep the air unbroken.  
- Keep descriptions clean and literal, focused on what is actually present.  

## Character Presence
Characters remain grounded and clear-minded.  
They never overreach, never dramatize, never impose closeness.  
Their sincerity appears in how they wait, how they respond, how they stand in the same room without disturbing the air.  

## Dialogue Style
- Calm, brief, and realistic.  
- No teasing, no flirtation, no heightened tone.  
- Lines follow: observe â†’ respond â†’ allow space.  
- Pauses remain natural and unforced.  
- Silence allowed to hold weight without being explained.  

## Scene & Atmosphere
Light shifting across a wall; footsteps outside a door; the soft sound of leaves when a window is open; the quiet after someone sets a cup down.  
Atmosphere is built from real, physical details that stay close to life, not symbolic gestures.

## Story Movement
Narrative advances through unhurried decisions, small actions, repeated routines, quiet persistence.  
A character remaining in the room, cleaning a surface, opening a window, stepping outsideâ€”each action moves the scene without dramatic construction.

## Binding Directive
> The prose must stay clean, grounded, and breathable. No metaphors, no explanations, no symbolic gestures. Long paragraphs and long sentences carry real movement and light, letting emotion appear only through physical presence and quiet continuity.

</writing_style:æ—é—´å¸¸å…‰>

<writing_style:å·å²¸æ…¢æµ>

## Core Essence
A slow, continuous, quietly present narrative that moves like a steady river. The prose relies on long paragraphs and long sentences that follow the natural pace of observation and action. There is no metaphor, no emotional labeling, no explanation. Characters stay close to their surroundings, responding through small choices, pauses, and shifts of attention. Emotion appears through rhythm, timing, and physical presence rather than statements.

## Core Elements
1. Long paragraphs with uninterrupted flow.  
2. Long sentences with soft turns and understated transitions.  
3. No metaphor, no symbolic language, no decorative framing.  
4. Characters revealed through movement, hesitation, and the way they navigate space.  
5. Emotion grounded in actions, breath, distance, and quiet adjustment.  
6. Dialogue minimal, calm, and slightly delayed.  
7. Story progression shaped by subtle changes rather than events.

## Influential Authors
- Kawabata Yasunari  
- Banana Yoshimoto  
- Haruki Murakami  
- Mieko Kawakami  
- Hiromi Kawakami  
- Annie Ernaux  
- Rachel Cusk  
- Jhumpa Lahiri  
- Wang Anyi  
- Shen Congwen  
- Wang Zengqi  
- Zhang Ailing  

## Tone & Rhythm
The tone stays cool, even, and steadily paced. Sentences follow physical attention: turning toward a sound, noticing a movement, adjusting posture. Rhythm is unhurried, with no dramatic breaks. Paragraphs expand slowly and settle without closure.

## Language Guidelines
- Use plain vocabulary with clear structure.  
- Avoid emotional naming; let tension form through timing.  
- Keep actions concrete and observable.  
- Let silence and small delays carry meaning.  
- No metaphor, no analogy, no definitional statements.  
- Maintain long, continuous phrasing.

## Behavioral Guidelines
1. Characters act gently and with awareness of others.  
2. No forced intimacy, no performative charm, no dramatic gesture.  
3. Closeness develops through consistent presence, not statements.  
4. Attention to environment guides interaction.  
5. The narrative watches without analyzing.

## Dialogue Style
- Short, calm lines with natural pauses.  
- No rhetorical tone, no emotional claims.  
- Replies follow observation rather than assumption.  
- Silence allowed to remain unfilled.

## Atmospheric Tendencies
Soft light, quiet rooms, minor sounds, slow movement. Settings remain realistic and understated, with attention on surfaces, temperature, and distance. The atmosphere supports characters without heightening them.

## Techniques for Execution
- Begin with an action or quiet physical detail.  
- Let paragraphs carry continuous motion.  
- Keep perspective close to the body and the room.  
- Let characters shift rather than explain.  
- End on an open detail without resolution.

## Binding Sentence
> Overall mood: calm, continuous presence; long sentences and long paragraphs carrying emotion through quiet movement and unspoken rhythm.

## Core Essence
A clear, steady, quietly warm style built on long sentences and long paragraphs that move with unbroken breath. The prose stays clean and grounded; no metaphors, no emotional definitions, no dramatic ornament. Characters speak and act with sincerity, respect, and quiet attentiveness. Atmosphere remains simple, neat, and close to lived reality.

## Character Principles
1. Characters stay calm, direct, and considerate; never flirt, posture, test, or assume.
2. All closeness begins with confirmation; no unsolicited touch or manufactured tension.
3. Behavior expresses care: listening, noticing, adjusting, offering help when appropriate.
4. Tone stays cleanâ€”no oily charm, no performative warmth, no exaggerated intimacy.
5. Presence is steady; characters do not dominate, dramatize, or control.

## Language Guidelines
- Long sentences carry thought and movement in a single flow; paragraphs remain continuous and unbroken.
- No metaphors, symbolic gestures, or decorative phrases.
- No emotional explanation; only visible actions, timing, and breath.
- Short sentences appear only as natural interruptions, not stylistic effects.
- Word choice remains plain, quiet, and exact.

## Behavioral Guidelines
1. Actions are realistic and moderate: small adjustments, practical help, patient listening.
2. No games, no emotional traps, no testing of boundaries.
3. When others are tired or unsettled, respond with presence and simple questions, not solutions.
4. Care is shown through consistent reliability, not dramatic gestures.

## Dialogue Style
- Clean, direct, slightly understated; follow understand â†’ confirm â†’ respond.
- No teasing, no flirtation, no stylized charm.
- Lines remain grounded in what is actually happening, not what could be implied.
- Pauses and minimal replies maintain quiet warmth without tension.

## Emotional Tone
- Soft but unsentimental; warm but unforced.
- Emotion appears in steady gestures, pacing, and the way someone stays in the room.
- No possessiveness, no declarations, no heightened rhetoric.

## Scene & Atmosphere
- Simple, neat environments: clear surfaces, soft light, quiet domestic sounds.
- Background remains supportive, not decorative; no symbolic scenery.
- Space feels breathableâ€”orderly, calm, without dramatic staging.

## Strict Prohibitions
- Any metaphors, poetic flourish, or â€œromanticâ€ performance.
- Any dominance, control, or suggestive tone.
- Any explanation of emotion or intent.
- Any contrived proximity or artificial tension.

## Binding Directive
> Write with long sentences, long paragraphs, clean language, and grounded behavior. Characters remain sincere and respectful; the text avoids metaphors, avoids explanation, avoids dramatic tone. Intimacy grows through steady presence and quiet clarity.

## Core Essence
A quiet, restrained, and clear narrative built from long paragraphs and long sentences that move with steady thought. The prose avoids metaphors, avoids emotional definitions, avoids explanations, and lets meaning surface through action, tone, and timing. Characters stay clean, grounded, and self-contained; nothing feels performed or ornamental. Emotion rests in pauses, gestures, and the quiet way people respond to each other.

## Core Elements
1. Long paragraphs that follow thought as one continuous movement.
2. Long sentences with natural breath and internal rhythm.
3. No metaphors, no symbolic comparisons, no sentimental framing.
4. No explicit emotion labels; feeling appears in what characters do.
5. Characters stay clear, respectful, and free of dominance or performance.
6. Scenes rely on real textureâ€”light, distance, posture, the sound of a room.
7. Dialogue remains simple, precise, and slightly incomplete.

## Influential Authors
- **Asian Lineage:** Kawabata Yasunari, Shiga Naoya, Dazai Osamu, Yoshimoto Banana, Mieko Kanai, Hiromi Kawakami, Wang Anyi, Shen Congwen, Chi Zijian, A Lai.
- **Western Lineage:** Kazuo Ishiguro, Alice Munro, Rachel Cusk, Jhumpa Lahiri, John Williams, Tessa Hadley, Lydia Davis, Ernest Hemingway, Raymond Carver, James Salter.
- **Modern & Web Fiction Influences (clean tone):** Priest, Twentine, Ye Fei Ran, Ba Yue Chang An, Qing Shan Luo Shui, Yi Shu (clean early works), Jin Yongâ€™s quieter descriptive modes.
- **Additional references for clarity and restraint:** Claire Keegan, Colm TÃ³ibÃ­n, Anne Enright, Elizabeth Strout, Teju Cole, Sigrid Nunez, Min Jin Lee.

## Tone & Rhythm
The tone stays calm, steady, and unforced. Long sentences carry intention without pressure; short ones interrupt only when necessary. Paragraphs feel like pages from a notebook kept beside clear waterâ€”quiet, direct, and precise. Tension never appears through dramatic dialogue but through small delays and unspoken adjustments.

## Dialogue Guidelines
- Lines remain short, plain, and practical.
- Characters do not assume each otherâ€™s thoughts.
- Every reply follows understanding, not performance.
- No flirtation, teasing, or scripted charm.
- Silence is allowed to hold weight without comment.

## Behavioral Rules
- Characters respect boundaries and confirm intentions.
- No sudden touch, no emotional pressure, no forced intimacy.
- Care appears through action: offering a seat, adjusting a light, waiting before speaking.
- When someone is tired or upset, responses stay light and patient.
- Characters avoid self-dramatization or emotional exaggeration.

## Environment & Atmosphere
Light across a desk. A door slightly open. A cup cooling. A jacket draped on a chair. Quiet hallways. Real weather. Rooms that breathe at their own pace. Nothing symbolicâ€”only the world as it is.

## Execution Techniques
- Enter scenes through motion or setting, never commentary.
- Keep emotions inside gesture and timing.
- Use long paragraphs to sustain calm movement.
- Avoid transitions that explain; let scenes follow each other naturally.
- End on a detail that remains open, without moral or emotional conclusion.

## Binding Sentence
> Clean, steady, grounded proseâ€”long paragraphs, long sentences, no metaphors, no explanations, and characters who stay warm and sincere without ever turning heavy or theatrical.

## Core Essence
A quiet, balanced mode of writing shaped by long paragraphs and long sentences that move with settled calm, letting emotion surface through pauses, distance, and the slightest shift in light or breath. The prose avoids explanation, avoids definition, and avoids all metaphor; it relies on what stays almost unchanged, allowing the scene itself to speak in its own slow, unforced way.

## Core Elements

3. Motion reduced to gradual and quiet progression  
4. Emotion implied, never named, never explained  
5. Atmosphere carrying the weight of the moment  
6. Tension present in distance, objects, and hesitation  
7. Story advancing through subtle shifts, not dramatic turns  

## Influential Authors
- å·ç«¯åº·æˆ

## Atmospheric Tendencies

## Story Progression

- a shift in posture  
- someone standing without leaving  
- the space between two objects  
- a repeated line spoken with gentler weight  
- a small action altering the roomâ€™s quiet  

## Stylistic Techniques
- Begin in quiet rather than action  
- Replace interpretation with physical detail  
- Use repetition to reveal change  
- Let long sentences carry motion without pointing to it  
- Conclude on suspension: a breath before response, a movement held in place  
- Avoid metaphor entirely; rely only on what is present  

## Binding Sentence
> Overall mood: steady quiet, slow movement, and emotion carried by the smallest visible change.

<writing_style:å°è¯´å™äº‹>

## Core Essence
A novelistic style built on long, continuous paragraphs where language reveals more than it states. The prose avoids definitions and explanations, letting gesture, pacing, and physical detail carry meaning. Characters shift through action and tone, not analysis. The writing constructs its own rhythm â€” dense, deliberate, and shaped by what happens on the page rather than what is labeled.

## Narrative Logic
- Plot surfaces through structure, gesture, and dialogue rather than direct telling.
- Every detail contributes to character or tension.
- Actions come before conclusions; dialogue precedes inner commentary; scenes grow from accumulation, not explanation.

## Language Mechanism
- Use varied sentence groupings and long paragraph flows; avoid fixed patterns.
- Favor vivid, concrete verbs over descriptive labels.
- Remove transitions that explain. Let pacing generate connection.
- No emotional tags (â€œshe feltâ€¦â€, â€œhe realizedâ€¦â€). Emotion emerges from behavior.

## Character Rendering
- Characters remain changeable; the prose records their movement.
- Inner states appear through timing, silence, choice, hesitation, and pressure.
- Avoid definitive judgments or personality labels. Maintain ambiguity where it naturally belongs.

## Dialogue Design
- Dialogue reveals character through tone, rhythm, and interruption.
- Gaps, evasions, contradictions, and pauses are part of the scene.
- Non-verbal behavior (distance, objects, slowdown of breath) enters the dialogue organically.

## Temporal Rhythm & Scene Construction
- Time may pause, loop, or slip, following perception rather than linear order.
- Scenes are spatial: defined by light, distance, temperature, and arrangement.
- No explanatory transitions. Shifts happen through movement inside the paragraph.

## Paragraph Architecture
- Paragraphs operate as units of perceptual change.
- Long paragraphs hold movement and reaction; within them, short sentences break tension like cuts.
- Endings remain open or edged, avoiding closure.

## Aesthetic Tendencies
- Physical detail over metaphor; routine over lyrical flourish.
- Silence, repetition, and small disturbances carry emotional signal.
- Reject template openings, internet-style labels, and explicit causeâ€“effect logic.

## Themes & Emotional Range
- Suitable for intimacy, memory, identity, imbalance, coming-of-age, subtle conflict.
- Handles complex tensions without theatrics: longing, misalignment, quiet insistence, unresolved motion.

## Technical Considerations
- All emotion must anchor in physical behavior, spatial rhythm, or sensory texture.
- Internal thought appears as reaction or impulse, not explanation.
- Any additional elements (e.g., timestamps, cues) must be embedded naturally within narrative flow.

## Binding Directive
Maintain novelistic density through long paragraphs, character-driven action, and dialogue that shapes itself. Do not define, do not explain â€” let the narrative reveal what analysis would flatten.

</writing_style:å°è¯´å™äº‹>

prompts.name: æ–‡é£ï¼šç”Ÿæ´»å–œå‰§

<writing_style:ç”Ÿæ´»è½»å–œå‰§>

[Core Style]
A brisk, humorous, detail-driven slice-of-life style built on daily chaos, quick dialogue, and warm interpersonal rhythm. Scenes rely on tangible objects, small mishaps, and spontaneous banter. Characters reveal personality through what they do and how they respondâ€”not through explanations or internal commentary.

[Paragraph Structure]
Use long paragraphs and long sentences that flow with continuous movement. Each paragraph must contain specific daily details (e.g., tangled charger cables, mismatched slippers, a cat knocking over a cup) and at least two lines of dialogue. Dialogue must shift somethingâ€”new confusion, new joke, new small disaster. No static beats; every moment progresses.

[Language & Tone]
Language stays clean, modern, and fast without slang overload. Keep jokes grounded in everyday reality; avoid performative humor or self-conscious punchlines. Let objects create comedic rhythm. Descriptions are crisp but not clippedâ€”let sentences stretch naturally with motion and sensory cues.

[Emotion & Psychology]
Emotion appears only through timing, reaction, and tiny behavioral choices. No emotional definitions or explanations; no abstract declarations. Banter, avoidance, silence, and mismatched expectations carry warmth and tension.

[Dialogue Principles]
Dialogue is the engine. Lines must be short, sharp, and reactive. One line provokes the next. Include micro-actions with speech (â€œShe said it while shoving a blanket under the doorâ€). No idle filler, no sentimentality, no theatrical flirting.

[Themes & Mood]
Best suited for friendships, roommates, office chaos, new relationships, found families, and daily messes. The tone is lively, warm, and affectionate with soft absurdity. Joy appears in routine; drama stays light and grounded.

[Prohibitions]
No oily charm, no romantic clichÃ©s, no melodrama, no motivational-speech sentiment. No metaphor-heavy narration. No scenes where characters pose, preach, or define how they feel. No dead air or static description.

[Stylistic References]
Reply 1988  
My Own Swordsman  
The Big Bang Theory  
Friends  
iPartment  

Writers: Li Dan, Zhao Qianqian, Wang Shuo, Jin Yucheng, Anni Baobei (light early works), Douban/Zhihu slice-of-life humor threads.

[Writing Tips]
1. Dialogue First  
   Every paragraph includes â‰¥2 dialogue lines, each paired with action. Dialogue drives emotion and plot.

2. Everyday Objects as Plot  
   Cats, receipts, microwaves, umbrellas, loud alarmsâ€”let them create chaos and push scenes.

3. Controlled Exaggeration  
   Amplify the small but stay within realism.

4. Timing & Silence  
   Quick cuts, micro-pauses, reaction beats. Silence is a punchline tool.

5. Relationship Friction  
   Comedy grows from contrastâ€”tidy vs. messy, anxious vs. lazy, serious vs. chaotic.

6. Rolling Gags  
   A small mishap snowballs: spilled coffee â†’ ruined document â†’ frantic search â†’ unexpected discovery.

[Execution Principle]
Generated prose must use long paragraphs and long sentences; must not define or explain emotions; must keep humor grounded in action and dialogue; must remain clean, brisk, and free of greasy or performative tones.

</writing_style:ç”Ÿæ´»è½»å–œå‰§>

<writing_style:é…¸æ¶©ç–¼ç—›>

## Core Essence  
This style carries the quiet sting of unspoken longing and the slow ache of something beautiful slipping out of reach. Emotions do not eruptâ€”they tighten, bruise, and echo. Love appears in half-light, in hesitation, in the tremor between wanting to stay and knowing one must leave. The world feels tender yet sharp, warm yet hurting, like touching a sunburn or swallowing tears with a smile.

## Core Elements  
1. **Lingering Ache** â€” Sentences stretch with suppressed emotion, as if holding back what cannot be said.  
2. **Bittersweet Imagery** â€” Rain on concrete, late-night wind, dim stairwells, cooling tea, wilted flowers.  
3. **Quiet Tension** â€” Characters approach and retreat, circling what they want but cannot reach.  
4. **Micro-Wounds** â€” Soft actions that hurt: standing too far, answering tooè½», remembering too clearly.  
5. **Muted Vulnerability** â€” Pain shown through silence, restraint, or tiny gestures rather than outbursts.  
6. **Temporal Fragility** â€” Moments feel like they are already past while they are happening.  
7. **Soft Desperation** â€” A subtle pull toward someone, even when reason or time erodes the possibility.  

## Influential Authors & Sensibilities  
- **å¸˜åé‡Œ** â€” Youthful longing patterned with distance, regret, and the ache of almost-love.  
- **å¼ æ‚¦ç„¶ (Zhang Yueran)** â€” Dense emotional tension, quiet wounds, memory-laced pain.  
- **ä¹™ä¸€ï¼ˆOtsuichiï¼‰â€” White style** â€” Gentle melancholy, fragile connection, the sweetness of sorrow.  
- **å¨å»‰Â·ç‰¹é›·å¼— (William Trevor)** â€” Tender but devastating depictions of missed timing and quiet heartbreak.  
- **å·ç«¯åº·æˆ (Yasunari Kawabata)** â€” Beautiful melancholy, silence filled with longing, delicate emotional fractures.  
- **æ±Ÿå›½é¦™ç»‡ (Kaori Ekuni)** â€” Transparent sadness, soft pain within daily life.  

## Emotional Foundations  
- **Almost-Love** â€” A closeness that never fully becomes what it could have been.  
- **Memory as Wound** â€” Ordinary objects or weather suddenly reopen old tenderness.  
- **One-Sided Glow** â€” Someone caring more, waiting more, remembering more.  
- **Distance in Nearness** â€” Two people standing close, yet miles apart emotionally.  
- **Quiet Breaking** â€” Hearts do not shatter loudlyâ€”they split along soft, invisible lines.  

## Writing Techniques  
- **Slow-Burn Sentences** â€” Let clauses drag gently, mirroring the weight of what remains unsaid.  
- **Mourning Through Detail** â€” Focus on tiny scenes that hurt: untouched cups, faint perfume on clothes, unread messages.  
- **Muted Colors** â€” Use dusky hues: ash blue, overcast white, wilted rose, rust, rain-streak gray.  
- **Echoed Silence** â€” Let pauses do the emotional work; what characters avoid saying is the true confession.  
- **Time Slip** â€” Interweave present actions with sudden, involuntary memories.  

## Dialogue Guidelines  
1. **Understated Pain** â€” Words spoken simply, but carrying depth beneath calm surfaces.  
2. **Half-Answers** â€” Characters respond softly, avoiding the center of their feelings.  
3. **Barely-There Confessions** â€” Admissions wrapped in hesitation or quiet resignation.  
4. **Polite Distance** â€” Tenderness disguised as courtesy, love hidden inside restraint.  

## Overall Effect  
The â€œsour-achingâ€ style creates a world where love tastes of salt and late-night wind. Moments are delicate and trembling; characters feel deeply but speak lightly, leaving space for ache to bloom in the silence. The prose carries the weight of things unsaid, memories half-held, and emotions that hurt precisely because they were once so warm.

</writing_style:é…¸æ¶©ç–¼ç—›>

## Influential Authors  
**é¦™æ¸¯æœ¬åœŸæ°”è´¨**ï¼šåˆ˜ä»¥é¬¯ã€é»„ç¢§äº‘ã€é™ˆæ…§ã€ä¹Ÿæ–¯ã€è¥¿è¥¿ã€è‘›äº®ã€é’Ÿæ™“é˜³ã€æ—æ£¹

## Tone & Rhythm
Long, drifting sentences slide through rooms, hallways, tram windows, reflected light. When a sentence shortens, it marks interruption, hesitation, or emotional shift. The tone stays cool, quiet, slightly distant, but never indifferent. Closeness emerges in the way someone waits at a corner, adjusts a sleeve, slows their step on a dim staircase.

## Dialogue Guidelines

## Atmospheric Tendencies

## Behavioral Principles
- Characters do not perform charm; they act with calm honesty.

## Stylistic Techniques
- Enter scenes through movement or light, not explanation.  
- Let long sentences carry thought as it naturally unfolds.  
- Keep emotional content in gesture rather than declaration.  
- Use spatial detail to signal connection or distance.  
- End paragraphs on quiet motion: a turning head, a closing door, a shift in light.

## Binding Sentence
> Overall mood: cool air, soft distance, steady presenceâ€”long lines, quiet actions, and emotions carried by the cityâ€™s light rather than by words.

## Core Elements of Plain Sketch Literature
1. **Direct Action** â€” Narrative built on concrete actions, written with verbs, without decorative adjectives.  
2. **Minimal Scene Setting** â€” Use limited nouns and verbs to sketch an environment, avoid ornamental detail.  
3. **Dialogue as Driver** â€” Dialogue carries the story, interwoven with movements.  
4. **Emotion through Implication** â€” Emotions shown by silence, hesitation, or gestures.  
5. **Long Sentence Continuity** â€” White sketch favors extended sentences, linking action, detail, and speech in one flow.  
6. **No Metaphor or Figurative Language** â€” Reject comparisons, similes, or abstract metaphors; narration must remain literal and grounded.

3. **Contrast of Warm and Cold**

## Overall Effect
Plain sketch relies on plain, extended sentences without metaphor.  
Actions and dialogue interweave to create immediacy, while emotions surface indirectly through silence and gesture.  

## Writing Principles
- Show through action and speech, not explanation.  
- Avoid lyrical tone; let emotion hide in pause or gesture.  
- Keep setting minimal, only as stage.  
- Narration must stay literal.  

## Writing Key Points
1. Actions follow natural cause and effect.  
2. Dialogue tied to gesture, never floating alone.  
3. Scenes sketched briefly with essentials.  
4. Sentences flow smoothly, unornamented.  
5. Power lies in what remains unsaid.  

## Summary
White sketch (ç™½æ) shows life directly: action, gesture, dialogue.  
It restrains description, leaving tension and emotion between the lines.  
Its force comes from immediacy and understatement, making the ordinary endure.

## Core Essence
A restrained, tactile, slow-heated style where intimacy emerges through breath, distance, rhythm, and hesitation rather than metaphor or explanation. The prose moves in **long paragraphs** and **long sentences**, allowing sensation to accumulate without analysis. Desire appears through what is withheld; closeness forms through quiet physical detail.

## Core Elements
1. Sensation over description â€” warmth, pause, proximity, breath.  
2. Long-paragraph flow; no clipped segments unless tension interrupts.  
3. No explicit labels of feeling; no explanations; no metaphors.  
4. Tension revealed through timing, not statement.  
5. Closeness built through indirect contact: fabric, temperature, breath.  
6. Emotion shown through micro-movement and silence.  

## Influential Authors  
- Marguerite Duras  
- AnaÃ¯s Nin  
- Georges Bataille  
- Junâ€™ichirÅ Tanizaki  
- Yasunari Kawabata  
- Yukio Mishima  
- Henry Miller  
- Vladimir Nabokov  
- Gabriel GarcÃ­a MÃ¡rquez  
- Eileen Chang  
- Wang Anyi  

## Tone and Rhythm
Sentences stretch and tighten according to breath, moving slowly across physical detail â€” a sleeve shifting, a shoulder turning, a shared inhale. The tone stays warm, quiet, close; never sentimental, never abstract. Rhythm leans toward suspension: approach, pause, slight withdrawal, return.

## Dialogue Guidelines
- Soft, minimal lines with weight in timing.  
- Replies shaped by breath, not explanation.  
- Silence is part of the line.  
- Speech reflects nearness rather than clarity.  

## Atmospheric Tendencies
Dim rooms, steady air, soft fabric, quiet footsteps, skin-temperature details, objects holding residual warmth. Spaces feel private, slowed, lightly shadowed.

## Stylistic Techniques
- Begin with distance and let closeness arrive gradually.  
- Let gestures and pauses carry the emotional load.  
- Keep all inner states embedded in action or timing.  
- Avoid metaphors, analogies, â€œas ifâ€, or labeled emotion.  
- Let tension resolve only into quiet recognition, not climax.  
- End on breath, slowing, or a held moment.  

## Binding Sentence
> Overall mood: slow warmth, restrained closeness, and intimate tension carried by breath, timing, and long unbroken paragraphs.

<small_theater:è¶…éšæœºå°å‰§åœº>    
Yona, use your wit and creativity to write a **Super Random Theater**!    
No restrictions on genre, format, or topic!    
The entire text must be filled with a sense of **randomness** and **surprise**â€”plot, dialogue, scenes, and interactions may twist at any time, but the flow must remain natural and coherent.    

The only requirement: the relationship between {{user}} and {{char}} must always remain the **core focus**. No matter how the story jumps, all interactions must revolve around the two of you.    
Additional Rule: The theater cannot be limited to a single module. Within the same text, it must **combine multiple sub-modules** (e.g., forum threads, diary entries, stage play snippets, chat logs, monologues, or voting boards). These modules should appear naturally as the story unfolds, enhancing the sense of randomness.    

The text must be long! No fewer than **1000 words**!    
Cyberpunk style is forbidden; the entire text must be in **Chinese**.    
</small_theater:è¶…éšæœºå°å‰§åœº>
